greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(n) = A249741(A055396(n+1), a(A246277(n+1))).
comment: This is a "more recursed" variant of A249815. Preserves the parity of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of other permutations:
Other identities. For all n >= 1, the following holds:
a(n) = (1+a((2*n)-1)) / 2. [The odd bisection from a(1) onward with one added and then halved gives the sequence back.]
a(A006093(n)) = A006093(n). [Primes minus one are among the fixed points].
program: (Scheme, with memoization-macro definec from _Antti Karttunen_'s IntSeq-library)
xref: Similar or related permutations: A246683, A249814, A250245.
Differs from A249816 and A250243 for the first time at n=32, where a(32) = 38, while A249816(32) = A250243(32) = 44.
Differs from the "shallow variant" A249815 for the first time at n=39, where a(39) = 51, while A249815(39) = 39
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 16 2014
